title: Readme file example, (Tree ensemble example with TreeExplainer) throws error
body:
URL: https://github.com/slundberg/shap
File: Readme

Code chunk:
========
```
# explain the model's predictions using SHAP values
# (same syntax works for LightGBM, CatBoost, scikit-learn and spark models)
explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(model)
shap_values = explainer.shap_values(X)
```

Error thrown:
=========
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
```
TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-18-9a042452a2d1> in <module>
      2 # (same syntax works for LightGBM, CatBoost, scikit-learn and spark models)
      3 explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(model)
----> 4 shap_values = explainer.shap_values(X)

/<PATH>/python/python-3.6.5/lib/python3.6/site-packages/shap/explainers/tree.py in shap_values(self, X, y, tree_limit, approximate)
    185                 phi = self.model.original_model.predict(
    186                     X, ntree_limit=tree_limit, pred_contribs=True,
--> 187                     approx_contribs=approximate, validate_features=False
    188                 )
    189 
TypeError: predict() got an unexpected keyword argument 'validate_features'
```
